relatedBlades.title: Making AI work for the public sector
relatedBlades.copy:
Artificial intelligence (AI) is a powerful technology that is changing how people work and is different from previous technological developments. While the hype surrounding AI is undeniable, a failure to think through the implications of integrating it can lead to "buyer's remorse," especially within the public sector where essential services and critical infrastructure are at stake.

- This ebook, "Making AI Work for the Public Sector," explores how leaders in the public sector can use AI to achieve positive outcomes while remaining aware of the risks, costs, and accountability involved.
- It focuses on maintaining security and managing budgets, as well as broader considerations like re-evaluating procurement processes and assessing vendor longevity.
- The document highlights the security implications of AI, including the increasing threat of AI-powered attacks and the risks posed by the uncontrolled spread of AI tools within organizations.
- It also examines the challenges of securing large language models (LLMs), which are fundamentally different from traditional web applications.

To download the full ebook and learn more about navigating the challenges and opportunities of AI in the public sector, please submit your details.
